function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Decreased satisfaction with the immediate living environment due to changes in spatial needs of occupants.","Impact":"Reduced user satisfaction and well-being.","Mitigation":"Designing more adaptable and flexible layouts for residential spaces.","Technologies":"Flexible furniture, modular design, movable partitions.","People":"Occupants of residential spaces.","Owner":"Architects, interior designers, and urban planners."},{"Description":"Limited options for reorganizing living space in small apartments.","Impact":"Reduced adaptability and flexibility of living spaces.","Mitigation":"Exploring innovative design solutions for small apartment units.","Technologies":"Multifunctional furniture, space-saving design, modular elements.","People":"Occupants of small apartments.","Owner":"Architects, interior designers, and urban planners."},{"Description":"Lack of contact with nature as a drawback of pandemic restrictions on leaving the residence.","Impact":"Negative impact on mental and physical health of residents.","Mitigation":"Integrating access to nature within the built environment, such as green roofs, indoor gardens, and ample natural lighting.","Technologies":"Green roof systems, biophilic design, sustainable building materials.","People":"Residents of built environments.","Owner":"Architects, urban planners, and property developers."}]}
